user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_get_timeout_i:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN int
MHD_get_timeout_i (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
#if SIZEOF_INT >= SIZEOF_INT64_T
  return MHD_get_timeout64s (daemon);
#else  /* SIZEOF_INT < SIZEOF_INT64_T */
  const int64_t to64 = MHD_get_timeout64s (daemon);
  if (INT_MAX >= to64)
    return (int) to64;
  return INT_MAX;
#endif /* SIZEOF_INT < SIZEOF_INT64_T */
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Only the conditional compilation block is reported because it is the only part of the function that can lead to code that is effectively excluded/unused depending on build-time macros (i.e. one of the two branches will not be present in a given build). All other parts of the function (the function signature, the variable declaration inside the compiled branch, the if/return logic within the else-branch, and the final braces) do not contain statements that are unconditionally unreachable in the source as written — there are no statements following an unconditional return within the same compilation branch, and the control-flow in the compiled branch(s) allows reaching each statement that remains after preprocessing. Therefore no additional fragments need investigation for unreachable-code issues.
